Component.RadModal.Footer.name: Component.RadModal.Footer
Component.RadModal.Footer.description: Simple wrapper for creating a modal footer.

Component.RadModal.Header.name: Component.RadModal.Header
Component.RadModal.Header.description:
Used to handle rendering a header for an Ember Radical Modal. Should always
be accessed via the `Header` prop or `components` hash of `rad-modal`.

### Accessibility

This component should only be used as a contextual component within a
`rad-modal` instance. The parent `rad-modal` handles setting the `elementId`
of this component to match an `aria-labelledby` on the parent modal.
This ensures that screen readers are able to correctly associate the modal
header with the modal that it labels. Some form of a Header is always
required for instances of Core Modal to ensure that they are properly
labelled.

#### Configurations
- `brand`: When accessing the header subcomponent in block form, you can use
  this property to access and apply standard branding classes to the header,
  e.g. `"primary"` or `"secondary"` .
- `closeButton`: Controls display of the header close button. Set to false to
  hide close button.
- `tagClose`: Pass an object of tagging data to have a tag event fired on
  click of header close button

Component.RadPopover.Content.name: Component.RadPopover.Content
Component.RadPopover.Content.description:
Popover tooltips to Make UI Great Again.â„¢
Child component to wrap the popover content.

Component.RadTabs.Content.name: Component.RadTabs.Content

Component.RadTooltip.Content.name: Component.RadTooltip.Content
Component.RadTooltip.Content.description:
CoreTooltip subcomponent for inner content. Requires properties `hidden` and
`aria-describedby` yielded by `rad-tooltip`.

Properties | Default | Description
--- | --- | ---
aria-describedby | '' | REQUIRED Used to bind id to tooltip title `aria-describedby` attr
hidden | true | Boolean that toggles `aria-hidden` attribute to handle show/hide of content

Component.RadTooltip.Title.name: Component.RadTooltip.Title
Component.RadTooltip.Title.description:
CoreTooltip subcomponent extends the `CoreButton` component. Requires
`aria-describedby` to bind to html attribute.

Properties | Default | Description
--- | --- | ---
aria-describedby | '' | REQUIRED Used to bind html `aria-describedby` attribute to tooltip content id
basic | `true` | Button `basic` class status. Pass false for a button style target
link | `true` | Button `link` class status. Pass false to suppress link styles

Component.RadAlert.name: Component.RadAlert

Component.RadButton.name: Component.RadButton
Component.RadButton.description:
The `rad-button` component is used for all user interaction targets in Ember
Radical. The component handles a number of housekeeping tasks including:
- Outline suppression only on clicks
- Tag firing when enabled
- Aria and html attributes

{{#rad-button}}Rad Button{{/rad-button}}

Configuration | Type | Default | Description
--- | --- | --- | ---
`link` | boolean | `false` | Toggles the `.btn-link` class, making the button look and act like a link
`brand` | {'primary', 'secondary', 'info' etc. } | `null` | Toggles brand class for a branded button

Component.RadCard.name: Component.RadCard

Component.RadDrawer.name: Component.RadDrawer
Component.RadDrawer.description:
Fully accessible expandable drawer/expandable content component. The `rad-drawer` component is the parent container for a set of `target` and `content` subcomponents, which represent the title/trigger text to open the drawer and the content to be revealed within the drawer, respectively. ## Usage There are two ways to use `rad-drawer`'s subcomponents: ### 1. Simple invocation via attrs If you only have simple text (or pre-determined text/HTML within a variable) to yield, you can simply use the `Target` and `Content` attrs on `rad-drawer` to auto-invoke the subcomponents, like so: ```glimmer {{rad-drawer Target='Click to read more about puppies' Content='Imagine five paragraphs about puppies instead of this one sentence.'}} ``` This is the easiest and quickest way to create an instance of `rad-drawer`. ### 2. Full invocation via contextual components If you have more complex needs in terms of the text/html/template code that needs to exist in either the `target` or `content` subcomponents, `rad-drawer` yields contextual components for both which you can access directly within the block invocation of `rad-drawer`. ```glimmer {{#rad-drawer as |components|}} {{#components.target}}

This is a very large drawer that will be hard to not see

{{/components.target}} {{#components.content}} {{/components.content}} {{/rad-drawer}} ``` You can also combine the use of attrs and contextual components: ```glimmer {{#rad-drawer Target='Click me! Come on, do it!' as |components|}} {{#components.content}} {{/components.content}} {{/rad-drawer}} ``` Additionally, the open/closed state of a `rad-drawer` can be updated from an external state source. This can be very useful for situations where you want another user interaction to trigger a drawer to open, or for setting a drawer to be open by default. For example, you may wish to use a button to automatically expand or collapse all core drawer instances at once. ```handlebars {{#rad-button click=(action 'changeSomeProp')}}Toggle Drawer{{/rad-button}} {{rad-drawer Target='Hello' Content='I am open now' externalToggle=someProp}} ``` {{#rad-state as |state stateActions|}} {{#rad-button click=(action stateActions.toggleState)}}Toggle Drawer{{/rad-button}} {{rad-drawer Target='Hello' Content='I am open now' externalToggle=state}} {{/rad-state}} `rad-drawer` will still continue to function normally with this property passed in, but it gives you the ability to control it externally. ## Properties Configuration | Type | Default | Description --- | --- | --- | --- `externalToggle` | boolean | false | Pass in any other property to cause `rad-drawer` to update when that property updates `icon` | string/boolean | 'arrow-down' | Specifies which SVG icon to show in the `target`. Hides the icon if set to `false` `buttonStyle` | boolean | false | Whether to style the `target` to look like a button ## A++ Accessibility Features - Drawer target auto-binds `aria-controls` to the value of the component ID - Drawer target auto-binds `aria-expanded` to the expanded/collapsed state - Show/hide of `content` is managed through `aria-hidden` attr

Component.RadDropdown.name: Component.RadDropdown

Component.RadModal.name: Component.RadModal
Component.RadModal.description:
### Ember Radical DDAU Modal Triggering modal open and close is handled using a data point to represent the open state instead of an event listener on body filtering for some identifier. This state should be handled by a data level service (could also be a route or component). #### Usage: **With Basic Header:** ```handlebars {{#rad-modal open=someService.modalActive Header='This is the modal title' closeModal=(action 'closeModal' target=someService)}}

This is a totally rad modal!

{{/rad-modal}} ``` **With Full/Custom Header:** ```handlebars {{#rad-modal open=someService.modalActive closeModal=(action "closeModal" target=someService) as |components|}} {{! Modal Header Subcomponent}} {{#components.header}}

{{rad-svg svgId="sparkles"}} It Just Worksâ„¢

{{/components.header}}

I will be yielded inside of the modal body! Don't worry about adding padding to me, the modal has 30px padding all around.

{{/rad-modal}} ``` **With No Header:** Even if you don't want or need a header for your modal, _some form of header text is required for 508 compliance_. ```handlebars {{#rad-modal open=someService.modalActive ariaHeader='This is the puppy modal' closeModal=(action "closeModal" target=someService)}}

Imagine several cute puppy images and/or gifs here.

{{/components.header}} ``` Note that `open`, `closeAction` and some form of a header are all required. #### Data Down A boolean data point `open` must be passed into this component. This data point represents the state of the modal and must be controlled by some parent context (a Service, Controller or some parent component). DO NOT MUTATE THIS DATA POINT IN THIS COMPONENT! When following DDAU this component will automagically rerender whenever the `open` state of your component changes because it is **passed down** as data. This removes the need for observers and event listeners (ðŸ™Œ ðŸ™Œ ðŸ™Œ) and allows us to programmatically open and close the modal based purely on user actions && application data/state. When `open` is truthy, the template will add a class `active` to the modal's `
`s. This class toggles visibility and fades in the modal using a CSS transition. (The `aria-hidden` attribute is used to control actual visbility for all users/browsers and screen readers; `active` is purely presentational) #### Actions Up Provide a closure action to the component as `closeModal`. This action will be automagically attached to the gray modal background. Whenever a user clicks the background, that action will relay the event to your parent context. You can then reliably handle whatever closing logic needs to happen and mutate your modal's `open` state on the parent context. This update will flow back down into the component and make the necessary changes to "close" the modal. #### Yielded Data This component will yield: - A `components` hash which you can use to directly invoke the `header` subcomponent for situations where you need more than just text in your modal header. You can reference in your template as: `{{#components.header}}Some text and elements here{{/components.header}}` - The `open` state of the modal, in case something in your header or modal body needs access to this state. #### Configurations The component can be configured with the following flags: - `animateFrom`: If you would like the modal to animate in, use this property to set up an animation direction; "left", "right", "top", or "bottom". - `autoFocus`: set to false to prevent the modal from refocusing the last element that was active in the DOM before the modal as opened. - `closeButton`: Controls display of the header close button. Set to false to hide close button. - `removeFromDomOnClose`: While you normally may wish to control whether your modal is being rendered at all via external logic, there are cases where you may be using the modal (e.g. in a wizard-like user flow) where you may want to have the modal destroy itself when it closes. Use this property if you want this kind of behavior. - `size`: Default size of the modal is 60% of browser width on desktop. You may optionally choose `small` (30%), `medium` (45%), or `full` (100%). Modals are always full-width on small screen sizes. #### Non-Dismissable Modal Create a modal that cannot be dismissed on click of the modal background by not passing a `closeModal` closure _(Modal components are set up with a no op `closeModal` action by default)_. Note that although not required, it's suggested to pass `closeButton=false` to suppress display of the close button because it won't do anything. ##### TODO: - Explore/Document how to handle having multiple modals of the same type? One modal with dynamic content? or multiple modals with modal ids? - Handle returning focus to the modal when a user tabs focus outside of the modal. Start with Bootstrap modals (which accomplish this). Can it be done without event listeners?

Component.RadPopover.name: Component.RadPopover
Component.RadPopover.description:
Popover tooltips to Make UI Great Again.â„¢ Use this component along with the subcomponent `rad-popover.content` to create popovers(super fancy tooltips). This component works by using mouse and focus events on **this** wrapping element. #### Sample Usage: ```handlebars {{#rad-popover as |components|}} {{#components.target}}Hover me{{/rad-button}} {{#components.content position="top" size="small"}}

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

{{/components.content}} {{/rad-popover}} ``` #### Configuration Properties A set of configuration properties can be passed into the child `{{rad-popover/content}}` component to control how its appearance. Here is a brief overview: - `position`: Where the tooltip is positioned relative to anchor element: - `top` - `bottom` - `left` - `right` - `bottom-left` - `bottom-right` - `size`: Preset width of the tooltip: - `small` - `medium` - `large` ```glimmer For full documentation, see the {{cross-link class="Component.CorePopover" item="position"}}position property{{/cross-link}} and the {{cross-link class="Component.CorePopover" item="size"}}size property{{/cross-link}}. ```

Component.RadState.name: Component.RadState
Component.RadState.description:
Component that can be used for tracking state changes with modals or drawers.
Wrap either in one of these and use the yielded state and actions to handle
showing/hiding/controlling your component.

Useful mainly for demonstration/documentation purposes, but also handy for
when you don't have a convenient place to store state (particularly during
early development stages). It's also kind of nice for not cluttering up your
parent scope with a bunch of extra state and actions you might not want to
hang onto. Go nuts!

## Usage

Instances of `rad-state` yield an `active` property and a hash of `actions`
for manipulating that state: `open`, `close`, and `toggleState`.

```handlebars
{{#rad-state as |state stateActions|}}
  {{bank-vault
    isOpen=state
    closeVault=stateActions.close
    openVault=stateActions.open}}
{{/rad-state}}
```

Or for a smipler toggling implementation:

```handlebars
{{#rad-state as |switchState switchActions|}}
  {{light-switch isOn=switchState toggleSwitch=switchActions.toggleState}}
{{/rad-state}}
```

The actions in the actions hash have already been yielded via the action
helper, so it is not necessary to continue using that helper when passing
actions into child components as properties (but you totally still can if
you would prefer to.

Component.RadSVG.name: Component.RadSVG
Component.RadSVG.description:
Core component for rendering svg icons. Expects an svg id as `svgId`.

#### Usage:
```handlebars
{{rad-svg svgId="bubbles" classNames="radical"}}
```

Component.RadTabs.name: Component.RadTabs
Component.RadTabs.description:
A++ Accessible tabs. The `rad-tabs` component is the parent container for
a given set of tabs and handles managing the active state of the tabs and tab
panels. The `rad-tabs` component yields a `content` contextual component
inside of the `components` hash.

#### Usage

```handlebars
{{#rad-tabs as |components|}}
  {{#components.content label="Delgrango's"}}
    This is my favorite resaurant at the marinara, name of Delgrango's
  {{/components.content}}
  {{#components.content label="Fresh Water"}}
    Boy I sure did work up a thirst after eating all them shramps. Time to
    wash it down with a cool glass of marina water.
  {{/components.content}}
{{/rad-tabs}}
```

You can include any number of `components.content` contextual components.
_(However keep in mind that adding too many `content` components may result in
the tab labels becoming unreadable depending on the space alotted for
displaying them.)_

You can also specify a default tab by setting the `defaultTab` parameter to
match one of content components' HTML id property:

```handlebars
{{#rad-tabs defaultTab="shrimpers" as |components|}}
  {{#components.content label="Shrimp" elementId="shrimpers"}}
    BRINGO! There's some pretty good lil' shrimpers in here, lets check it out.
  {{/components.content}}
  {{#components.content label="Delgrango's"}}
    This is my favorite resaurant at the marinara, name of Delgrango's
  {{/components.content}}
{{/rad-tabs}}
```

### Controlled Tabs
If you need to programatically open tabs within your application you can
create a controlled instance of `rad-tabs` by specifying the `activeId` for
the component. This means that you need to track the `activeId` in a parent
component or service and pass it down into the controlled tab instance. To do
this pass an `onChange` closure into the component. It will be called with
the `elementId` of the selected tab any time a user changes tabs.

### A++ Accessibility
- Tabs have `aria-controls` set to the `elementId` of the `tabpanel` they show.
- Tabs have `role=tab` for role identification
- Tabs are instances of `rad-button` for keyboard access
- Show/hide of tabs and panels are managed through `aria-hidden` attr

### Feature Notes:
- The tab list is a flexbox container with flex-grow 1 for each tab. This auto
  magically grows the tabs to fill the entire width of tab container.

Eq.name: Eq
Eq.description:
Helper to compare two values to see if they are equal. Uses strict equal
comparison

params.name: args
params.description: Positional args passed to helper which should be compared

InstanceInitializer.FixedBody.name: InstanceInitializer.FixedBody
InstanceInitializer.FixedBody.description:
This initializer handles sniffing the current browser's scrollbar width. This
is used by modals to handle freezing the body on open, but can be used by
any fixed width element that needs to freeze the body using the class
`.fixed-scroll-padding-element`.

Tagging.name: Tagging
Tagging.description: Base tagging class. Provides methods for pushing data into the data layer.

Util.Analytics.SetupGTM.name: Util.Analytics.SetupGTM
Util.Analytics.SetupGTM.description:
Analytics Setup Script

This script will insert a script tag to pull down the google tag manager
library. That library will also handle pulling down the google analytics
library.

Invoke this function with the unique GTM container ID from you friendly
neighborhood analytics contact.

_NOTE: will attach `dataLayer` to window for namespacing analytics events._

params.name: containerId
params.description: Unique id matching application GTM id

The position that the tooltip is created in relative to its anchor element.
Valid options are:
- `"top"`
- `"bottom"`
- `"left"`
- `"right"`
- `"bottom-left"`
- `"bottom-right"`

Defaults to `"bottom"` if no value is supplied.

The size of the tooltip itself. A list of preset sizes available are:
- `"small"`
- `"medium"`
- `"large"`
- `"x-large"`

Defaults to `"medium"` if no value is supplied.

not have the data it needs to display information at the time when

hidden while preserving its place in the list.

classitems.description: Behavior to execute when clicking the button; pass any closure action in and Ember's built-in click event listener will execute it for you.
classitems.name: click

classitems.description:
Computed css class bound to component. Handled by component to allow for
flexibility in future updates to branding class names
classitems.name: brandClass

classitems.description:
ALLLLLLLLLLL the attributes you might need.
NOTE: `role` should not be bound here. You can set the role of a button
by passing an [ariaRole](http://emberjs.com/api/classes/Ember.Component.html#property_ariaRole) prop.
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Bind standard rad classname for component: `rad-button`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description: Handle binding brand and link related css class names
classitems.name: classNameBindings

classitems.description: Button DOM element
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Include type button for usability.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
The `mouseDown` event is used for some utility/housekeeping methods because
we use the `click` event to pass in actions.

Handle setting the outline on this element to `none` because we know this
event is only triggered by actual mouse clicks. Keyboard events don't trigger
it, which is a convenient way to know we're good to hide the outline and
maintain usability for keyboard users. A++ accessibility!

Handle checking for a tagging category and if one exists, fire a tag.

If you need to override this event, be sure to call `this._super();`
classitems.name: mouseDown

classitems.description:
The `mouseEnter` checks for a tagging category and hover flag. If they're
present a tag is fired.

If you need to override this event, be sure to call `this._super();`
TODO: Only include this if Tagging feature is enabled
classitems.name: mouseEnter

classitems.description: Pass a brand to use to style the component and it's child components.
classitems.name: brand

classitems.description: Computed css class for the brand bound to the component.
classitems.name: brandClass

classitems.description: Bind standard core class: `card-footer`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description: Bind props to classes on the root component element.
classitems.name: classNameBindings

classitems.description:
By default, the `target` subcomponent will display as a plain link. If you
would like it to display as a button, set this to `true`.
classitems.name: buttonStyle

classitems.description: Allow for external controls to update the open/closed state of a `rad-drawer`
classitems.name: externalToggle

classitems.description:
If you want to use a different SVG icon from the default on your `target`,
specify it by name/id here. If you don't want to display an icon
at all, pass `false` into this property
classitems.name: icon

classitems.description: Unique id for binding `aria-controls` in subcomponents
classitems.name: ariaId

classitems.description: Bind `rad-drawer` to component
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
State boolean for display of the drawer content. Is toggled true/false to
handle show/hide. Updated in `toggleHidden`
classitems.name: hidden

classitems.description: Auto-binds `data-test` attributes
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description:
The component's `didReceiveAttrs` hook. Allows udpates from external state
to adjust the `hidden` state of a `rad-drawer` instance.
classitems.name: didReceiveAttrs

classitems.description: Actions Hash
classitems.name: actions

classitems.description: Toggle internal hidden property. Pass state boolean if specific state is needed.
classitems.name: toggleHidden

classitems.description: Adds a brand class to the target as btn-{brand}
classitems.name: brand

classitems.description: Whether or not to style the target as a link or a button
classitems.name: buttonStyle

classitems.description: Whether or not to treat the dropdown content component as a dropdown menu
classitems.name: dropdownMenu

classitems.description: Fires when the dropdown is closed
classitems.name: onHide

classitems.description: Fires when the dropdown is opened
classitems.name: onShow

classitems.description:
State boolean for display of the dropdown content. Is toggled true/false to
handle show/hide. Updated in `_showContent` and `_hideContent`
classitems.name: hidden

classitems.description: Auto-binds `data-test` attributes
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Bind `rad-dropdown`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
Safety first!
If we leave the page without closing the dropdown we don't want to orphan
listeners.
classitems.name: willDestroyElement

classitems.description: Actions
classitems.name: actions

classitems.description:
Handle the showing of the dropdown. This will pass on any arguments you
pass to it in the action.
classitems.name: show

classitems.description:
Handle the hiding of the dropdown. This will pass on any arguments you
pass to it in the action.
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description:
If a modal should not have a visible header, pass a label for the modal
using this property. It will be bound to a hidden div with the correct
aria attrs so that we're rocking A+ accessibility all day every day.
classitems.name: ariaHeader

classitems.description:
Unless autoFocus is toggled to false, the modal will store a
reference to whatever element is currently active in the dom and return
focus to that element when the modal closes.
classitems.name: autoFocus

classitems.description: CSS transitions the modal on open. Accepts 'left', 'right', 'bottom', 'top'.
classitems.name: animateFrom

classitems.description:
Controls display of the modal header close button. Is defaulted to true and
can be set to false in order to suppress the header close button.
classitems.name: closeButton

classitems.description: Controls the SVG Id of the close button.
classitems.name: closeIcon

classitems.description:
Flag used to handle showing and hiding the modal. This property
should be passed in by a component/service+controller that controls the
state of the modal.
classitems.name: open

classitems.description:
Determines if the modal should be removed from the DOM when it is closed.
This is to help performance on the beefier modals.
classitems.name: removeFromDomOnClose

classitems.description:
The size of the modal to display. The default size caps the width of the
modal at 60% of the browser's viewport. Additional sizes available are:

- `"small"` (30% on large, 45% on medium)
- `"medium"` (45% on large, 60% on medium)
- `"full"` (100% on large and medium)

Modals will always render at 100% on mobile/small screen view.
classitems.name: size

classitems.description:
Pass a string for simple text modal header. If the modal should have no
header, pass null to this property. This will ensure that `aria-labelledby`
is _not_ bound to the modal instance (because there is no header to label
the modal).
classitems.name: Header

classitems.description:
Pass a `(hash)` of tagging properties when you need to bind a tag fire to
close of the modal. Expects syntax:
`(hash category="Tag Category" action="Tag Action" label="Tag Label")`
classitems.name: tagclose

classitems.description:
Closure action passed into the modal. Is event delegated to the modal
background for close on click (unless 'hideBackground' is true)
classitems.name: closeModal

classitems.description:
Determines if the modal is currently _active_, which means that the modal
has been opened/closed. Note that this is different from _visible_. Due to
transition time, a modal can be _active_ but not yet _visible_ to the user.
Seperate props are required for tracking active vs visible to allow the
css animations to trigger.
classitems.name: _active

classitems.description:
Private reference to the last focused element in the DOM before the modal
was opened. This is used to make the experience for keyboard users not
terrible.
classitems.name: _lastFocusedElement

classitems.description:
Determines if the modal should be rendered in the template. This is not
equivalent to `open`. In order for CSS transitions to work properly, the
modal must be rendered in the DOM when the class that applies the
transition is added to/removed from the modal.
classitems.name: _visible

classitems.description:
Handle modal cleanup here:

- Unfreeze body
- Remove 'active' class from modal elements to hide them if still in DOM
- Return focus to last active element unless disabled (for better
  usability)
classitems.name: _handleClose

classitems.description:
Handle modal open work here:

* Freeze the body so that scrolling inside the modal doesn't jank up the
  screen
* Add 'active' class to modal elements, if the modal is already in DOM this
  will make it visible
* Set private reference to currently active DOM element so we can return
  focus to it when the modal closes (for usability)
classitems.name: _handleOpen

classitems.description:
Whenever this component receives attrs check if the `open` prop matches the
template status. If not, call the handlers for open/close
classitems.name: didReceiveAttrs

classitems.description:
When modal is inserted into DOM, check if it should be open by default, if
so we need to call `_handleOpen` manually to open it.
classitems.name: didInsertElement

classitems.description:
willDestroyElement hook used to ensure that all of the closing logic that
needs to happen fires off.

**NOTE:** This will make sure that the body doesn't get frozen in place if
your modal isn't cleaned up, but when you navigate back to whatever created
this modal it may still be open. If this is the case remember that the
open state of your modal is a data down property which needs to be cleaned
up on whatever parent context controls it.
classitems.name: willDestroyElement

classitems.description:
The position that the tooltip is created in relative to its anchor element.
Valid options are:
- `"top"`
- `"bottom"`
- `"left"`
- `"right"`
- `"bottom-left"`
- `"bottom-right"`

Defaults to `"bottom"` if no value is supplied.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description:
The size of the tooltip itself. A list of preset sizes available are:
- `"small"`
- `"medium"`
- `"large"`
- `"x-large"`

Defaults to `"medium"` if no value is supplied.
classitems.name: size

classitems.description:
Unique string used to handle setting up aria roles for A++ usability. This
identifier needs to be set as the `aria-describedby` attr of the popover
hover target and the `id` of the actual popover content
classitems.name: aria-describedby

classitems.description: Auto-binds `data-test` attributes
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Bind standard core class: `rad-popover`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
State boolean for display of the popover content. Is toggled true/false to
handle show/hide. Updated in `_showContent` and `_hideContent`
classitems.name: hidden

classitems.description: Component element: div
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Handle showing tooltip content
classitems.name: _showContent

classitems.description: Handle showing tooltip content
classitems.name: _hideContent

classitems.description:
Checks for a position prop value; if none was supplied, set a default
of `bottom`
classitems.name: didReceiveAttrs

classitems.description: Show content on mouse enter
classitems.name: mouseEnter

classitems.description: Hide content on mouse leave
classitems.name: mouseLeave

classitems.description: Show content on focus
classitems.name: focusIn

classitems.description: Hide content on focusOut
classitems.name: focusOut

classitems.description: Boolean state tracking property. Use this to handle show/hide status.
classitems.name: active

classitems.description:
Rad State is a purely functional component with no rendered output of its
own, so it doesn't need a root element cluttering up the DOM when it's
being used.
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Actions hash
classitems.name: actions

classitems.description: Sets the [active](#property_active) property to false.
classitems.name: closeModal

classitems.description: Sets the [active](#property_active) property to true.
classitems.name: openModal

classitems.description: Sets the [active](#property_active) property to passed state.
classitems.name: toggleState

classitems.description: File path to svg definitions file
classitems.name: filePath

classitems.description: The id of the svg.
classitems.name: svgId

classitems.description:
Allow direct binding of `data-test` attributes so that icons can be
directly targeted in automated testing.
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Class names: `rad-svg`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description: Bound classNames: `svgId`
classitems.name: classNameBindings

classitems.description: SVG DOM element
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description:
The elementId of the currently opened tab. This determines which tab is active and
which tab's content to display. If this is empty, no tabs are open.
classitems.name: activeId

classitems.description: Pass false to use tab style without primary color tabs.
classitems.name: buttonStyle

classitems.description:
Whether the content pane subcomponents should take on the appearance of
a `rad-card`.
classitems.name: card

classitems.description:
The optional elementId of the tab that should be shown by default. This is
useful for cases where the user has come into a page and is expecting one
of the tabs to be shown by default.
classitems.name: defaultTab

classitems.description:
Optional closure action that will be called whenever a tab is opened with
the id of that tab. Use this to create a controlled tabs instance.
classitems.name: onChange

classitems.description:
Whether the page should scroll the tab context back to the top when one of
the tabs is clicked. This can be a nice convenience for usabilitee.
classitems.name: scrollOnClick

classitems.description:
What the target of the `scrollOnClick` behavior should be. By default,
the entire page/body scrolls, however if this instance of `rad-tabs` is
contained within a modal or some other scrollable sub-container, it may
be more desirable to execute a scroll against that instead of the entire
page. Simply pass a standard jQuery-like selector in as a string.
classitems.name: scrollTarget

classitems.description:
Bound attributes:
- `data-test`: for precise testing identification
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Class names: `rad-tabs`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
List of tabs to display. This is iterated through in the template to
rendered the buttons that are used to change tabs.
classitems.name: tabList

classitems.description:
Internal method that can be used with a `run.once` call to only add new tabs
once per run loop. Simply iterates through `_tabsToCreate` and pushes them
into the `tabList`. This is needed to prevent multiple renders in a single
run loop when all of the `content` subcomponents register themselves with
the container during init.
classitems.name: _createTabsList

classitems.description:
When the component initializes, we set the `tabList` property to an array.
This prevents multiple instances of rad-tabs on a given page from
inheriting the same tabList array through prototype inheritance.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Action to show a tab. Set `activeId` to the passed elementId. `activeId`
is passed down to children content components
classitems.name: showTab

params.name: elementId
params.description: HTML id of the tab to show

classitems.description:
Closure action passed to content subcomponents that is called on init.
Each child tab will register itself with this container. To ensure the
tabList is only updated once per render, we proxy new tabs to the
`_tabsToCreate` array and then push all of them to `tabList` using a
`run.once` call to `_createTabsList`
classitems.name: registerTab

params.name: tab
params.description: Object model of tab to be registered

classitems.description:
Closure action passed to content subcomponents that is called whenever
a tab has updated in a way this container needs to know of. Currently
this is only when a tab's `hidden` status changes.
classitems.name: updateTab

props.name: elementId
props.description: HTML id of tab to update

identifier needs to be set as the `aria-describedby` attr of the tooltip
hover target and the `id` of the actual tooltip content

State boolean for display of the tooltip content. Is toggled true/false to

classitems.description:
Method for pushing an object into the data layer. Used to set the custom
dimensions included with tags.
classitems.name: pushData

params.name: data
params.description: Object of key/value pairs mapping to custom dimensions

classitems.name: fireTag

params.name: tag
params.description: Tag object containing all of the tag data

classitems.description: Send a page view by pushing virtual pageview event into data layer
classitems.name: firePageView

params.name: page
params.description: url of the page to send

classitems.description:
Method or generating a unique string to use for binding aria-controls
attributes. Returns a prefix with elementID.
classitems.name: controls

return.description: Unique string for use with binding `aria-controls`

classitems.description:
Method for generating a unique string to use for binding aria-describedby
attributes. Returns a prefix with elementID
classitems.name: describedby

return.description: Unique string for use with binding `aria-describedby`

classitems.description:
Method for use with binding aria-expanded. Returns string of negated boolean
for hidden.
classitems.name: expanded

return.description: String of negated boolean hidden for expanded

classitems.description:
Method for use with directly binding `aria-hidden` to a component which
requires a string boolean b/c Ember will remove the attribute if it is
boolean false.
classitems.name: hiddenForArias

classitems.description:
Method for generating a unique string to use for binding aria-labelledby
attributes. Returns prefix with elementID
classitems.name: labelledby

return.description: Unique string for use with binding `aria-labelledby`

classitems.description:
Handle binding a listener to an element that calls a callback (typically a
close method) when the escape key is pressed.
classitems.name: closeOnEscape

params.name: cb
params.description: The method to call when the escape key is pressed

classitems.description: Handle unbinding escape listener.
